thread.title: Sydney’s double blow that could shape Derby
thread.title_full: Sydney’s double blow that could shape Derby

title: Sydney’s double blow that could shape Derby
text:
Sydney FC suffer double blow, Bobo double, second half drama: Central Coast v Sydney wrap 18 minutes ago by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS WHILE Sydney FC rolled on with another impressive A-League win, the runaway leaders have also been dealt a major double blow ahead of next week’s Sydney Derby. 
After seeing off Central Coast in a drama-filled five-goal game, the Sky Blues’ preparation for next week has been hindered by the losses of Sebastian Ryall and Josh Brillante. 
Winning 3-2, with a double from marquee man Bobo and a controversial David Carney winner, the first dagger blow came in the second minute when Ryall was forced off with what appeared to be a serious hamstring injury. 
REPORT: Mariners blow chance as Sydney juggernaut rolls on 
With stalwart Matt Jurman departing during the week for a life-changing two-year deal in South Korea, Ryall wore the armband before slipping and twisting awkwardly as the Mariners attacked early. 
That forced Graham Arnold to introduce Brillante off the bench, having been initially left out of the starting line-up to protect him from a suspension, sitting on four yellow cards for the season. Sounds like a long term inury for Seb Ryall. — Ray Gatt (@Gatty54) January 8, 2017 Early diagnosis of Seb Ryall's injury is a hamstring for @SydneyFC defender - assume he's definitely out of the derby at least, prob longer — Tom Smithies (@SmithiesTele) January 8, 2017 
Sure enough, in the 65th minute, Brillante was cautioned, meaning Sydney will have to make massive adjustments before facing Western Sydney Wanderers. Ryall injury. Source: FOX SPORTS 
Brandon O’Neill had replaced Ryall at the heart of defence, but could be required in midfield, with Brillante’s suspension. 
“I’ve played centre back a little bit and you always have to prepare for the worst so I’ve practised it at training so I’m comfortable there,” O’Neill explained to Fox Sports. 
Here are all the main moments from Mariners v Sydney FC … 
BERNIE IBINI MAKES STARTING RETURN 
Last time Bernie Ibini started in the A-League, it was in the 2014-15 Grand Final against Melbourne Victory. 
But after sealing a dream move to Club Brugge soon after, he suffered a nightmare broken leg on the first pre-season session which forced him out for a length period. 
Returning to Sydney FC, the 24-year-old made his first start in 18 months against his former club. Bernie Ibini of Sydney FC. Source: Getty Images 
“He’s been very patient, with the club moving very slowly with Bernie,” Andy Harper said. “He’s such a rich talent and he’s been exciting every time we’ve seen him in the A-League.” 
BOBO QUICKFIRE DOUBLE 
Sydney’s marquee man scored two goals either side of Sydney FC, proving his worth. 
The first goal, in the 43rd minute, was a classy finish as he linked up with Filip Holosko for a knockdown in the box. Then just two minutes into the second half, Milos Ninkovic was the provider, calmly finding the Brazilian to tap home and make it 2-0. Tony Popovic watches on ahead of the Sydney Derby. Source: FOX SPORTS 
MARINERS RECOVER AND LEVEL 
Then, things got interesting. 
After Brillante picked up his booking, the Mariners punished Sydney, also thanks to an error from Holosko, who directed his defensive header to Roy O’Donovan at the back post. 
Fabio Ferreira had the chance to level things from the penalty spot but could only send the ball into orbit. However he quickly turned provider for Scott Galloway in the 76th minute. Ferreira's penalty flop 1:03 
CARNEY SPARKS LATE DRAMA 
Within a minute, David Carney sealed another win for Sydney FC, in dramatic circumstances. After good lead up work from Michael Zullo, the substitute smashed home the ball, from an off-side position — a call which infuriated Mariners boss Paul Okon.
